comments.body: Later, we'll have to deal with instabilities in gensyms when pieces of code get moved around. But for this PR, the current situation with synthetic names is okay.

comments.body:
What is the canonical way to distinguish between the `var method` getter and setter?

```
 +_root_.flags.p.package.AA#`z_=`(Int). => var method z_=: (x$1: Int): Unit 
 +_root_.flags.p.package.AA#z(). => var method z: Int 
```
It does not seem to be possible to distinguish them with kind/properties alone.
SLS mandates the `_=` suffix for setters, so that should be a canonical way.

comments.body: `abstract` and `sealed` are interesting additions. `final` is pretty nuts. Looking forward to getting this sorted out in https://github.com/scalameta/scalameta/issues/1162.
haha yes, `abstract final` makes no sense :joy:
